snippet: Consumer spending rose 0.4 percent in December, but incomes showed no gain, indicating that employment growth is slowing.
abstract: Commerce Department reports that Americans increased their spending at solid pace for second straight month, even though incomes were flat; consumer spending rose 0.4 percent in Dec 2013, but incomes showed no gain, indicating that employment growth is slowing.
lead_paragraph: Consumer spending rose 0.4 percent in December, but incomes showed no gain, indicating that employment growth is slowing.

headline.main: Incomes Are Flat, Reflecting a Slowdown in Job Growth, but Consumer Spending Rises
headline.print_headline: Incomes Are Flat, Reflecting a Slowdown in Job Growth, but Consumer Spending Rises
